727204f-a.title: Queens: Lefferts Boulevard - Hillside Avenue
727204f-a.text:
86.21 Lefferts Boulevard, east side, between Hillside and
Jamaica Avenues, showing Boolwinkel and Erooss' grocery store.
This building first appears on an 1891 map.
P. L. Sperr  August 22, 1932
727204f-a.folder: Lefferts Boulevard & Hillside Avenue, Queens, NY

727205f-a.title: Queens: Lefferts Boulevard - Hillside Avenue
727205f-a.text:
86.09 Lefferts Boulevard, adjoining the S.E. corner of
H:iIlside Avenue. This old house was Public School No. 8 of
Richmond Hill as shown on 1873 and 1891 atlases. On the right
is a one-story building of the Richmond Hill Republican Club.
P. L. Sperr  August 22, 1932
727205f-a.folder: Lefferts Boulevard & Hillside Avenue, Queens, NY

727206f-a.title: Queens: Lefferts Boulevard - Hillside Avenue
727206f-a.text:
Lefferts Boulevard, at the S.E. corner of Hillside Avenue,
showing a rambling house. It first appears on a 1909 map. A
sign on the porch reads: Simonson, Undertaker.
P. L. Sperr  August 22, 1932
727206f-a.folder: Lefferts Boulevard & Hillside Avenue, Queens, NY

726853f-a.title: Queens: Hillside Avenue - Lefferts Boulevard
726853f-a.text:
Hillside Ave., south side, between Lefferts Boulevard and 118th
Street (formerly Church Street), showing a Carnegie Library in
Richmond Hill, Jamaica.
About 1910.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
726853f-a.folder: Hillside Avenue & Lefferts Boulevard, Queens, NY

727210f-a.title: Queens: Lefferts Boulevard - Hillside Avenue
727210f-a.text:
86.17-19 Lefferts Boulevard, east side, between Hillside
and Jawaica Avenues.
P. L. Sperr  August 22, 1932
727210f-a.folder: Lefferts Boulevard & Hillside Avenue, Queens, NY
